description.narrative: For GGF funds will be used to further Observatorio Latinoamericano de Conflictos Ambientales' (OLCA) work in trying to phase out the use of endosulfan in several Latin American countries. It will work with the International POPs Elimination Network (IPEN) and Red de Accion en Plaguicidas y sus Alternativas para America Latina (RAP AL) (two partner networks) in order to disseminate information regarding the decision of the COP5 to the Stockholm Convention's decision to ban the use of endosulfan. Ten countries in Latin America still have not fully ratified this ruling, so OLCA will engage in a public awareness campaign with communities government, and universities to disseminate information about the harms of endosulfan, as well as the rulings of the handful of countries that have banned its use. They will work with authorities in all countries to propose non chemical alternatives to the use of the deadly pesticide and continue to monitor endosulfan poisoning incidents
